text: I've read many times that some operations don't benefit from multithreading because they are memory bound. But in practice, what kind of operations does this apply to? I imagine it depends a lot on the hardware, i.e. a machine with 100 CPUs has a much higher RAM bandwidth than a 4-CPU laptop?

text: To first order, it depends on how many LOAD and STOREs (array accesses) you have in a kernel in comparison to floating point additions and multiplications.
